channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9579] Sanity check visiblity and audience for server-side modules.
item.description:
Similar to HBASE-9495 we should audit the hbase-hadoop*-compat, hbase-prefix-tree, hbase-protocol and hbase server-modules.

I'll go through each module first making most things private, and then do a second pass using some sort of LimitedPrivate marking for apis that we'd expect coprocs or advanced tests to use.

This is less urgent that the work for the client facing apis.
item.summary: Sanity check visiblity and audience for server-side modules.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
How many @InterfaceAudience.Public are there in the server side modules?


grep -R -L  InterfaceAudience.Public hbase-$MODULE/src/main/java | grep \\.java |wc

* 878 (including hbase-common, hbase-client).
hbase-server 551
hbase-hadoop-compat 28
hbase-hadoop1-compat 27
hbase-hadoop2-compat 26
hbase-prefix-tree 37
hbase-protocol 28

looks like it doesn't make sense to add annotations to hbase-hadoop-compat and hbase-hadoop1-compat because annotations are borrowed from hadoop2 common libs. (a little silly to add a hadoop2 dep to an hbase on hadoop2 – to other hbase libs do depend on it..)

Oops, that was the wrong command to list the publics (the previous command counted all java source files that weren't public)


; need lower case -l.

grep -R -l InterfaceAudience.Public ....

hbase-server 97
hbase-hadoop-compat 0
hbase-hadoop1-compat 1 // ?!
hbase-hadoop2-compat 0
hbase-prefix-tree 1 // an enum
hbase-protocol 0

tl;dr categorization of hbase-server

  • Public: all MR mapreduce related classes. (users would subclass)
  • Private: o.a.h.h.mapred (since all deprecated)
  • Keep Public: utility classes with user callable main methods (hbck, hfilepretty printer, hlog pretty print, etc)
  • Added LimitedPrivate("coproc") for coprocs api
  • Private: Distributed procedure related
  • Keep Public: exceptions
  • Keeping rest as is because I'm not familiar with it.

Private: o.a.h.h.mapred (since all deprecated)

Please leave these public as mapred is deprecated but still heavily used. For instance, I have hopes to wire in support for hadoop-streaming clients, all of which goes through mapred AFAIK.

Keeping rest as is because I'm not familiar with it.

The REST gateway implementation is not intended for public interaction, but it would be nice to keep the package documentation public so users can see how things are parsed. I'm not sure how you do that with your fancy new javadoc stuffs.
attached patch that privatizes a bunch.

All of the existing o.a.h.h are actually marked private except for two classes – I made those two private to be consistent.

The APIs are visible still in the full api – there are just two javadoc links and two builds:

one for the user facing api: http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/
one with all the full internals in all their glory: http://hbase.apache.org/devapidocs/

Should I make all the o.a.h.h.mapred public then?

Sounds like for rest I should make them private or limitedpublic(rest)? They will show up in the dev api java docs.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12604113/hbase-9579.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

-1 hadoop2.0. The patch failed to compile against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7304//console

This message is automatically generated.
missed a patch when I merged and created the original version. this fixes the compile for hadoop2 and adds license and interfaceaudience annotations to HBaseInterfaceAudience.

updated stats:


grep -R -l InterfaceAudience.Public $MODULE/src/main/java/

hbase-server 55
hbase-hadoop-compat 0
hbase-hadoop1-compat 0
hbase-hadoop2-compat 0
hbase-prefix-tree 0
hbase-protocol 0

Should I make all the o.a.h.h.mapred public then?

Yes, thanks.

Sounds like for rest I should make them private or limitedpublic(rest)? They will show up in the dev api java docs.

My desire is for the REST package-info docs to be included in user-facing documentation. This is the most complete documentation for the REST gateway public syntax.
ok, I'll do another rev taking account these changes.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12604141/hbase-9579.v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

-1 hadoop2.0. The patch failed to compile against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7309//console

This message is automatically generated.

i like the cp annotation addition

+@InterfaceAudience.LimitedPrivate(HBaseInterfaceAudience.COPROC)

nice

Interesting making metrics private.... suppose thats fine... forces those that would read them to go via published interfaces, jmx, etc.

THis should be private?

-@InterfaceStability.Evolving
+@InterfaceAudience.Private
public abstract class FSUtils {

Hmmm.. I suppose this general utility... but no harm making it internal

-@InterfaceAudience.Public
+@InterfaceAudience.Private
@InterfaceStability.Stable
public class HashedBytes {

+1

THis should be private?
-@InterfaceStability.Evolving
+@InterfaceAudience.Private
public abstract class FSUtils {

Putting the question slightly different slant – should all application writers have the ability to traverse and potentially modify HBase's hdfs dirctory structure? I think only hbase services should be touching that stuff (or via a helper interface like hbck). Marking private doesn't mean they don't have access to these methods – it just means that they shouldn't unless they are willing to deal with the api changing. (and gives us the ability to change these).

Hmmm.. I suppose this general utility... but no harm making it internal
-@InterfaceAudience.Public
+@InterfaceAudience.Private
@InterfaceStability.Stable
public class HashedBytes {

Honestly, it seems like a wrapper that provides little value – it is only used in 5 lines of HRegion and if anything should be folded in as a private static inner class in that class. Let's keep it private. 


jon@swoop:~/proj/hbase-trunk$ grep -R HashedBytes . | grep \\.java

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java:import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.HashedBytes;

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java:  private final ConcurrentHashMap<HashedBytes, RowLockContext> lockedRows =

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java:      new ConcurrentHashMap<HashedBytes, RowLockContext>();

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java:      HashedBytes rowKey = new HashedBytes(row);

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java:    private final HashedBytes row;

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java:    RowLockContext(HashedBytes row) {

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/HashedBytes.java:public class HashedBytes {

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/HashedBytes.java:  public HashedBytes(byte[] bytes) {

./hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/util/HashedBytes.java:    HashedBytes other = (HashedBytes) obj;

Nick Dimiduk I've attached a screen shot of docs generated with this and HBASE-9585 applied. Rest docs are still there (though you have to navigate in the main frame as opposed to using the two left frames to get to it).

I've looked a little more carefully at the rest related methods that i was considering making private. They actually are a java implementation that talks to the rest server. So, I'll leave them public.
v3 makes all of the o.a.h.h.mapred public and also does some other tweaks.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12604205/hbase-9579.v3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Sounds reasonable. I'm good w/ this.
Awesome Jon. +1.
Committed to 0.96 and trunk (patch applies 0.96 except for one class that doesn't exist in 0.96 – just skip it).
